japanese: ふああぁぁ……。
translation: *yawn*

japanese: あれ、フータロー？
translation: Huh, Futaro?

japanese:
ああ、おはよう。
そういや今日の朝飯の当番は三玖だったか。
translation:
Hey, good morning.
Oh, you were on cooking duty for breakfast this morning,
huh, Miku.

japanese:
おはよう。
早起きだね、昨日は遅くまで起きてたのに。
translation:
Good morning.
You're up early, even though you were up late yesterday.

japanese:
言っておくが寝不足じゃないぞ？
ちゃんと寝て、普通に目が覚めたら
この時間だったんだ。
translation:
I haven't overslept, okay?
I properly slept, and when I got up normally,
it was this time.

japanese:
くまが出来てるわけじゃないし、
眠そうにも見えない。
うん、よろしい。
translation:
You don't have dark circles under your eyes,
and you don't look sleepy.
Very well, then.

japanese:
よろしいって。
三玖こそ、朝飯を作るにはちょっと早くないか？
translation:
Very well, you say.
Aren't you up a little early yourself
to make breakfast?

japanese: 少し、凝ったものを作ろうと思って。
translation: I thought I'd make something a little more elaborate.

japanese:
この島にいるのも、あと３日。
改めて残りの日を頑張ろう……みたいな感じ。
translation:
We'll be on this island for three more days,
so I'll do my best for the rest of the time...
something like that.

japanese:
なるほどな、いいんじゃないか。
俺も何か手伝うぞ、どうせ暇だし。
translation:
I get it, isn't that nice?
Let me help you with something, I've got nothing to do.

japanese:
ううん、フータローは待ってて。
眠そうじゃなくても、昨日は遅くまで
仕事してたんだから。
translation:
No, just wait, Futaro.
You may not look tired,
but you were working late until yesterday.

japanese:
そうか？
じゃあ、お言葉に甘えるかな。
translation:
Is that so?
In that case, I'll take you up on your offer.

japanese: ……なんだか新婚さんみたい。
translation: ...It's like we're newlyweds.

japanese: なんか言ったか？
translation: Did you say something?

japanese:
ううん、何も。
じゃあ、私、料理の続きをするね。
translation:
No, nothing.
Alright, I'll keep on cooking.

japanese:
なあ、三玖。
近くで見ててもいいか？
translation:
Hey, Miku.
Can I watch you up close?

japanese: えっ？　な、なんで？
translation: Huh? Wh-why?

japanese:
さっき言ったろ、暇なんだよ。
お前の仕事ぶりを眺めてるのもいいかと思ってな。
translation:
As I said, I've got nothing to do.
I was just thinking, watching you work would be nice.

japanese: 邪魔なら無理にとは言わないが。
translation: If that'd bother you, I won't force anything.

japanese:
ううん、邪魔じゃない。
……いいよ。
translation:
No, it wouldn't be a problem.
...Go ahead.

japanese: ……そ、そこまで新婚さんにならなくてもいいのに。
translation: ...W-we don't need to act THIS much like newlyweds.

japanese:
ええと、昨日の夕食に使った
食材がまだ残ってたはずだから……。
translation:
Umm, there must still be some ingredients
leftover from yesterday...

japanese: あとは、これを使ってもう一品、かな。
translation: So then, if I use this, it'll be ready.

japanese: すっかり料理してる姿が板についたな。
translation: I've really gotten accustomed to you cooking.

japanese: ……そ、そう、かな？
translation: ...I-is that, so?

japanese:
でも私も、この無人島生活の中で
すごく料理ができるようになったと思う。
translation:
But I think I've become really good
at cooking during this deserted island life.

japanese:
へえ？
三玖にしては大きく出たな。
translation:
Wowww!
That's a big thing for you to say, Miku.

japanese:
むう……。
からかわないでよ。
translation:
Mmm...
Don't tease me.

japanese:
悪い悪い。
でも実際、無人島にいる間、
ずっと率先して料理当番を引き受けてくれたしな。
translation:
Sorry, sorry. But actually,
the whole time we're on this deserted island, you took
the initiative to take on cooking duties.

japanese:
うん……。
二乃とらいはちゃんにも、いっぱい料理のことを
教えてもらえたし。
translation:
Yeah...
Nino and Raiha-chan too,
they taught me so much about cooking.

japanese:
あと、限られた食材の中で、
どうやって美味しいご飯を作るとか……
そういうのも、すごくいい経験になった。
translation:
Also, how to make delicious rice
with limited ingredients...
Those kinds of things were also great experiences.

japanese:
確かに、下手な料理教室に通うくらいなら
あいつらに教わったほうが絶対いいよな。
translation:
Certainly, rather going to a bad cooking class,
it'd definitely be better to learn from them.

japanese:
だが、なにより三玖自身が
上手くなりたいってずっと頑張ってきたんだ。
これは、その成果だろ。
translation:
But above all, you yourself have been working hard
to improve. This is the result of your efforts,
right, Miku?

japanese: そ、そんなことは……。
translation: T-that's...

japanese:
って！？　おい！　鍋！
もう沸騰してるぞ！
translation:
Oh?! Hey! The pot!
It's already boiling!

japanese: あああっ！？
translation: AAAAH?!

japanese: ……セーフ。
translation: ...We're safe.

japanese:
間一髪だったな。
料理中なんだから、ちゃんとそっちに集中しておけ。
translation:
That was close.
You're cooking, so concentrate on that.

japanese: フータローが話しかけてきたのに。
translation: Even though you're the one who talked, Futaro.

japanese:
そうだった……。
すまん、結局、邪魔しちまったか。
translation:
That's true...
Sorry, in the end, I bothered you.

japanese:
……いいよ。
フータローに見てもらいながら料理するの、楽しい。
translation:
...It's fine.
I enjoy cooking while you're watching.

japanese:
（いまさらだが、この状況は……。
　妙にこっぱずかしいというか、
　誰かに見られたら……）
あれ！？　三玖さんとお兄ちゃん！？
translation: Huh?! Miku-san and big bro?!

japanese: うおっ！？
translation: WOAH?!

japanese:
もしかして私、寝坊しちゃった？
ごめんなさい！
translation:
Did I perhaps oversleep?
I'm sorry!

japanese:
ううん、違うよらいはちゃん。
少し早く起きちゃったから、先に始めてただけ。
translation:
No, you didn't, Raiha-chan.
I woke up a little earlier,
so I just started first.

japanese:
なんだ、そっかぁ。
よかった、寝坊してなくて。
translation:
Ohh, I see.
Oh good, I'm glad I didn't oversleep.

japanese:
でも、どうしてお兄ちゃんまでいるの？
一緒にお料理してる……わけじゃないよね。
translation:
But, why is big bro here too?
Are you two cooking together?
Nah it...couldn't be.

japanese: ああ、俺はただ見てただけだな。
translation: Yeah, I've just been watching.

japanese:
ええ～？
そこは、俺も手伝う！　って言うところだよ？
translation:
Huhhh?
That's when you're supposed to say,
'I'll help out too!', you know?

japanese: 見てるだけでいいって言われたんだよ。
translation: She told me that it was okay to just watch.

japanese:
わかってないなぁ。
三玖さんは優しいからそう言っただけだよ。
translation:
You just don't get it.
Miku was just saying that to be kind.

japanese:
そういうときこそ、俺に任せな、って、
格好よく手伝わなきゃ。
translation:
That's especially the time when you should say
'leave it to me' and help out in a cool way.

japanese:
ま、待ってらいはちゃん。
フータロの言う通り、私がそう言ったんだよ。
だからフータローを責めないで。
translation:
W-wait, Raiha-chan.
It's like Futaro said. That IS what I said.
So, please don't blame him for anything.

japanese:
でも、だからって本当に
ずーっと見てるだけなのは、どうかと思うなぁ。
translation:
But, even so,
just watching the whole time seems wrong.

japanese:
わかったわかった。
手伝うよ。
translation:
I got it, I got it.
I'll help out.

japanese:
じゃあ、もう少ししたらお味噌汁ができるから、
味見を手伝ってもらえる？
translation:
Okay then, the miso soup will be ready in a little bit.
Can you taste it for me?

japanese: ああ、任せてくれ。
translation: Yeah, leave it to me.

japanese:
確かに、少しは手伝うべきだった。
すまん三玖。
translation:
Yeah, you're right. I should have helped out a little.
Sorry, Miku.

japanese:
気にしないで。
見ててって言ったのは私のほうだし。
translation:
Don't worry about it.
I was the one who told you to watch.

japanese: えっ、そうだったの？
translation: Huh, really?

japanese:
実はフータロー、昨日は遅くまで起きてたから。
だから、まだ疲れてると思って。
translation:
Well, the truth is, Futaro stayed up late last night,
so I thought he might still be tired.

japanese:
そうだったんだ……。
早とちりして、ごめんなさい。
translation:
Is that so...
I jumped to conclusions. Sorry.

japanese:
ううん、気にしてないよ。
フータローも、気持ちだけで充分。
ありがとう。
translation:
No worries.
Your willingness is more than enough for me, Futaro.
Thank you.

japanese:
……いや、やっぱり手伝わせてくれ。
らいはに言われたからってわけじゃないが、
このまま見てるだけなのは申し訳ない。
translation:
...No, I should help after all.
It's not fair to just watch.
I feel pretty guilty just watching like this.

japanese:
じゃあ、もう少ししたらお味噌汁ができるから、
味見を手伝ってもらえる？
translation:
Okay then, the miso soup will be ready in a little bit.
Can you taste it for me?

japanese: ああ、任せてくれ。
translation: Yeah, leave it to me.

japanese:
実は、見てるのも楽しくてな。
何度か手伝おうと思ったんだが。
translation:
Actually, it was just so fun watching.
Though I thought I'd help out a few times.

japanese:
へ……？
見てるって……私を？
translation:
Huh?
Watching? You mean...me?

japanese: 他にいないだろ。
translation: There's no one else here.

japanese:
あ、いや、別に変な意味じゃないぞ？
純粋に、三玖の成長が見れて喜ばしいと
思っただけだからな？
translation:
Ah, no, it's not like that, you know?
I was just happy to see how much you've grown,
purely for that reason, yeah?

japanese: ……ありがとう。
translation: ...Thank you.

japanese:
ま、まあ、あれだ。
お前が楽しそうに料理してるから、
それにつられたんだよ、たぶん。
translation:
Well, you know.
I probably just got caught up
in how much fun you were having cooking.

japanese: へーえ、そっかぁ。
translation: Wow, is that so.

japanese:
妙な目で見るな、らいは！
ええい、三玖！　俺に何か手伝わせろ！
translation:
Don't give me that weird look, Raiha!
Hey, Miku! Let me help you with something!

japanese:
え、ええっ！？
いきなりそう言われても……。
translation:
H-huhhh?!
When you say it all of a sudden like that...

japanese:
じゃあ、もう少ししたらお味噌汁ができるから、
味見を手伝ってもらえる？
translation:
Okay then, the miso soup will be ready in a little bit.
Can you taste it for me?

japanese: ああ、任せてくれ。
translation: Yeah, leave it to me.

japanese:
……できた。
フータロー、味見してみて。
translation:
...It's done.
Futaro, try it.

japanese: おう。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
どうかな？
味、変じゃない？
translation:
How is it?
Does it taste weird?

japanese: 大丈夫だ、美味いぞ。
translation: It's just fine. It's delicious!

japanese:
よかった。
じゃあ、次は……。
translation:
Good.
Alright, next...

japanese:
２人は息ピッタリだね～。
もしかして、私、お邪魔かな～？
translation:
You two are so in sync.
Am I maybe getting in the way?

japanese: ら、らいはちゃん！？
translation: R-Raiha-chan?!

japanese:
変なこと言うな。
というか、お前が手伝えって俺に言ったんだろ。
translation:
Don't say weird things.
Besides, didn't you tell me to help out?

japanese: だって新婚さんみたいなんだもん。
translation: But you guys look like newlyweds.

japanese: はあっ！？
translation: HUH?!

japanese:
……らいはちゃん。
具体的に、どう新婚さんに見えるのか詳しく。
translation:
...Raiha-chan.
Can you tell me specifically how we look like newlyweds?

japanese: み、三玖までなに言ってんだ！
translation: W-what are YOU saying now, Miku?!

japanese:
ああもう、俺はリビングに行くからな！
料理の邪魔だろ？
translation:
Oh, forget it. I'm going to the living room.
I'm just getting in the way of the cooking, right?

japanese: ……行っちゃった。
translation: ...He left.

japanese:
ごめんなさい、三玖さん。
せっかく２人きりだったのに。
translation:
Sorry, Miku-san.
You two were having such a good time alone together.

japanese:
ううん、いいの。
正直、あのままだったら
私も料理に集中できてたか怪しいし。
translation:
No, it's fine.
Honestly, if he hadn't left,
I might not have been able to concentrate on cooking.

japanese: ……新婚さん、か。
translation: ...Newlyweds, eh.
